ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Retrocochlear pathology (Left VIII nerve injury)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: History of head trauma, significant WRS rollover (0.40), degraded ABR waveforms, and preserved OAEs indicate neural dysfunction with intact cochlea.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Acquired Auditory Neuropathy Spectrum Disorder (ANSD)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: The dissociation between normal outer hair cell function (OAEs) and abnormal neural function (ABR, speech rollover) fits the ANSD profile, likely secondary to trauma.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Vestibular Schwannoma
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Pre-existing tinnitus and retrocochlear signs raise this possibility, though the acute onset of speech issues suggests a traumatic etiology.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To visualize the VIII nerve and rule out structural lesions, tumors, or traumatic injury.
To assess the vestibular system given the patient's report of unsteadiness.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Results indicate left-sided retrocochlear dysfunction characterized by a mismatch between intact cochlear function and impaired neural transmission.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear normal; Left ear normal sloping to mild high-frequency SNHL.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Significant rollover in the Left ear (ratio 0.40) suggesting neural pathology; Right ear normal.

tests.name: Otoacoustic Emissions (DPOAE)
tests.result_summary: Robust and present bilaterally, indicating intact outer hair cell function.

tests.name: Auditory Brainstem Response (ABR)
tests.result_summary: Right ear normal morphology; Left ear degraded/poorly formed waveforms.

proposed_items: Communication strategies (use right ear for phone)
Consider FM system or remote microphone if hearing aids are contraindicated due to distortion
counseling_actions: Explain the discrepancy between 'hearing volume' (cochlear) and 'clarity' (neural)
Discuss the implications of the rollover finding (louder speech becomes less clear)
Emphasize the importance of medical follow-up to rule out serious pathology given the trauma history

escalation.rationale_short: Signs of neural damage (retrocochlear pathology) following head trauma require immediate medical investigation.

follow_up_plan.timeline: Immediate referral; Audiology follow-up after medical evaluation.
follow_up_plan.objective: Determine etiology of neural dysfunction and manage based on medical findings.

expected_outcome: Confirmation of neural injury or pathology via MRI.
Potential diagnosis of traumatic VIII nerve damage.
